_header: Lordings that be now here / If ye will listen and lere
Bibliographic Ghosts:
London, British Library Cotton Julius A.V: deleted by Robbins and Cutler (1965)
XRossell Hope Robbins, and John L. Cutler. Supplement to the Index of Middle English Verse. Lexington, Kentucky: University of Kentucky Press, 1965.
_description: Robert of Brunne’s Metrical Chronicle — in two parts of 8365 and about 4500 couplets

InnerTem5117.First Lines:
Lorgynges þat be now hereif ȝe will listen &
                    lere…
InnerTem5117.Last Lines:
Idus þat is of Maij lest I to write þis rymeB letter &
                    friday bi ix þat ȝere ȝede prime
InnerTem5117.Note:
Shifts from two-column format to single at f. 96; same scribe, and
                    continuous rubric signatures for gathering ‘m’.
InnerTem5117.Attributed Title:
Incipit prologus historia britannie / transposita per Robertus in
                        materna lingua (f. 1, rubric); Explicit Historia britannie trans /
                        posita in lingua materna per Robertum / Incipiunt Gesta Anglorum sir patrum
                        de langtoft transposita per eiusdem R Mannyng f. 95va,
                    rubric); Expliciunt gesta Brittonium & Anglorum in lingua materna per /
                        Robertum Mannyng transcripsitur Anno xi Millisimo
                            CCCmotricesimo / viij idus Maij… (f. 195,
                    rubric)

Lam131.First Lines:
…God gyue me grace wel to spedeÞys Rym on Englisch for
                    to Rede…
Lam131.Last Lines:
…þe bost of kyng Philipp fayne wold he þen
                    fellearyued is Richard at þe depe of Normandie…
Lam131.Note:
Begins imperfectly at line 199; continues to Birth of Christ
                    only.
Lam131.Attributed Title: A Chronicle of England in olde Englishe meter (later hand)

OxfMert23b6.First Lines:
[ ] fflaundres [ ] philip a louerd [ ][ ] manore schip he was hire
                    gouernour…
OxfMert23b6.Last Lines:
…[ ]es to se and witnesse it wild nouht lie[ ]d of trestels
                    and of borde
OxfMert23b6.Note:
Lines 2040-2239, couplets; flyleaf bound in at beginning of 
            Lycophron, Willem, Lykophronos tou Chalkideos Alexandra (Basle, 1566): Oxford,
            Balliol College Library, shelfmark 23.b.6 . See Davis (1969)
XDavis,  Norman. 
             “Another Fragment of ‘Richard Coer de Lyon’.” 
             Notes and Queries
         16 (1969): 447-452, for an
                    account of this fragment.
